bow: want to put up my disabled month old for adoption done are there any support groups for parents of disabled children you should look and see it sounds like you are feeling rather alone in all of for different kind sometimes you have to try more than one to find something that works honestly do think there is any shame in placing your baby fire adoption if that what you ultimately decide is best for your family there are people out there who want to adopt children with special needs and have the resources to offer them the care they need but just as an anecdote have friend who son had stroke in utero possibly similar to your child he certainly has his challenges but if you saw him you wo know it to look at him except that he bit small for his age so your child may very well be fully capable of having good life hope that helps what country do you live in can you ask your child pediatrician for help please look for help and resources hope someone in this sub can provide you with more help than can my heart goes out to you and your daughter she needs you check out parent2parent org they have ton of resources and can hook you up with other parents with children with similar disabilities pt is going to take lot of time it is unlikely to see improvement so quickly in an infant be patient have soon with autism you go through the stages of grief almost like losing child you have to bury the child you dreamed of it is loss you will be depressed tired angry and much more but when you find super and see improvements you will feel excited happy and much more no one can really prepare for disabled child sorry that you feel you need to give up your child please take minute to check out that website before you make any decisions maybe you can find someone who can take custody of your child like close family member or friend you can be reassured that your baby is being loved and taken care of and you can still have contact explain the severity of the situation just as you explained to us one of them may be willing to help you you might also ask for help in parenting if you have already my brother has cerebral palsy and has ended up being great delight and lifelong companion to my parents can you get some help now to help you cope better and give the child another year or two before you decide to pass her to someone else that is serious decision and it could well be that the baby period and your initial adjustment is the hardest and afterwards things could be quite different caring for this child if you find way that you can indeed do it could drive degree of personal growth and development in you that very little else could achieve and your daughter will be eternally grateful however she certainly does want you over burdened or taking your life etc please talk more with us or the folks at breakingmom and other even more relevant forums for mums of disabled children and find the companionship support and wisdom you need if financial help would make great difference then consider that there could be ways to raise the money mother who wants to raise her daughter but needs for part time maid pt or anything else can likely find that type of financial assistance in today world hallelujah yes yes yes to the anti depressants for sure they ve helped me ton and just have nervous artistic overly sympathetic nature combined with the angst of having taken my hubbie away from his family in the developing world and the irritations of raising kids nowhere near the challenges of raising disabled child yes yes yes to all the help you can get and definitely antidepressants antistress meds will probably get downvoted for this but here goes do think your comment is realistic disabled children have to be incredibly lucky to find family most of them end up in the system and that is not even taking into account that op said herself social care is really bad in her country know you are just trying to be supportive and think the rest of your comment is really good it sounds like you do have lot of effective support and are overwhelmed which is completely understandable even healthy newborn can feel overwhelming and can bring on intense unprecedented feelings of depression intrusive thoughts etc know it seems just so hopeless and awful right now but like they say do make promises when you re happy do make decisions when you re sad you need sleep food self care you need more than few weeks of therapy maybe psychiatry is for you maybe you need counsellor or religious support maybe you need to find he right mix of antidepressants hell go to massage therapy if that floats your boat it ca hurt imagine my daughter alone in bed for the rest of her life and get so unbearably sad looking back now in sound health and mind at where seems impossible without you there is literally no one else who can speak for her they way you can pt will take time your health will take time but the time is going to happen regardless so you may as well use it well sorry it will take so much strength more than you think you can give but you will because we all give that much and more to our children too it mother way hugs just hugs you are overwhelmed and depressed and your brain chemistry ca handle it please go to your primary care doctor and or ob and tell them what you re feeling if they do take you seriously or help you go to the just for women in your situation if you want to share your location maybe one of us can do the heavy lifting of looking up services who can help you think it also very possible you are suffering from if could just give him up for adoption etc things would be better etc do want to discount your feelings but it also sounds like you are suffering from lack of support and resources do know about the from people would be able to give you more targeted suggestions am sorry you are going through this stress and feeling this way woah just woah my own daughter had brain hemorrhage during pregnancy as well totally track with you here nonetheless wish knew where you lived there may be resources in place to help you as your daughter as for adoption do want to guilt you out of it but prior to my daughter birth worked with adults with developmental intellectual disabilities have to warn you your daughter will likely not be adopted as disabled child what more likely is that she will be abused and neglected disabled adults and children are mistreated at disturbingly high numbers in foster governmental care in fact of the 30+ disabled adults on my caseload all in state care only had three that had no record of being abused neglected exploited in some way throughout their life so if you are thinking some foster family can do better at raising your daughter than you can statistics show that to be unlikely on the other hand you do need some help you are wrong or bad for feeling this way but you do have to stay stuck with these feelings either if it any consolation the condition your daughter dealt with is type of brain injury which means that months is not enough time to gauge what she is capable of and what her life is going to look like my daughter will be in few months and we are only just now getting good gauge for what her abilities are at months she was effectively potato it took year for her brain to heal and another year of intense therapy to see results but now she is exploding developmentally yes she still disabled but re situation is not as dire as it appeared initially all am trying to say is this months is not enough time to determine your daughter future so please do make determination based on that get some help for yourself and your daughter first then try to explore adoption if you still are sure do you live in north america can message you my cell number and we can text about it if you want some help ve been through the whole kit and kaboodle with my daughter medical stuff know how lonely it can get think you have post partum depression and possibly ptsd understand what you are going through to some extent my son was born early he would stop breathing during feeds so would have to watch his breathing pattern he almost passed away in front of me he also developed hypothyroidism and had bad ftt during this time we should have noticed his jaw tongue muscles were also weak but we had so many other medical issues we did he two now and is only speech delayed with some facial weakness he in therapy it hard in the beginning would often wish just died blamed myself for his health issues was very angry therapy helped lot whatever you choose to do is your choice what are the doctors saying about her progress in pt what is their professional option on the severity of her disability in the long term babies are resilient and the pathways in the brain are pliable and adaptable to an extent so keep some hope alive psychiatrist will only help with medications and biological neurological changes related to depression psychotherapist will help you figure out how to figure out all of your options and make the best decision if your country has give psychotherapists please consider this option and full support for the looking for support groups in person or online good luck to you as you figure out what you will do may you find way to move forward with peaceful heart that you are finding the best decisions you can are dealing with now if you can believe that nonetheless you are suffering you need help people are going to give you hand up you are going to have to take help for yourself call up every doctor she ever had and ask them what kind of resources they know of that can help you therapy support groups charities call churches and universities and ask them the same thing medical schools therapy schools dental schools call all of them see if they have clinics for their students to work in and if they are taking new patients are her doctors not trying to give you the information you need fire them they work for you you can fire them if they are doing their job well say so long and find another one yes sometimes there just is known answer for medical condition but the refusal to look into it any further is unacceptable these other moms you speak of try and create relationships with them they may know of things that can help you be honest and open about your feelings with them they ve probably been through it too get counseling for yourself anything you can afford if you ca afford anything try and find religious counseling anything is better than nothing take care of yourself eat well get exercise take vitamins and get sunshine treat your body right so that your mind can recover from the shock and anxiety in the interim some things to consider that might help your daughter look into occupational therapy not just physical therapy look into speech therapy too since there good chance she will have delays there as well there is high instance of something called cortical visual impairment among kids like your daughter her eyes may be perfectly fine but she still may have trouble seeing because the vision center of her brain might have been damaged this can cause global delays in children because how motivated would you be to explore the world around you if you could see well cvi goes overlooked lot but it totally treatable with vision therapy so maybe find someone who knows about cortical visual impairment and get her evaluated just in case do range of motion exercises with her they think it fun playtime at this age here are some links be gentle but do them consistently times day it will help keep her flexible and help her get the most out of physical therapy http www drnathbrachialplexus com images pdf babyromprint pdf http www family friendly fun com therapy baby range motion htm let her spend lots of time on her stomach while playing to encourage head control and strength feed her diet high in healthy fats like fish nuts olive oil avocado and coconut oil her brain needs these fats to continue to heal and develop properly moving not kidding we moved hours away ourselves because our daughter had so little resources where we lived before understand this may not be possible but it worth looking into if you can one last thing before finish up this novel your daughter loves you you love her you could control what happened to her while
